definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: And they sent also to the king of Moab, but he would not consent.
sentences.chinese: 又照样打发使者去见摩押王，他也不允准。

sentences.english: So he consented to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.
sentences.chinese: 委办便允准他们这件事，试看他们十天。

sentences.english: But it was only rather grudgingly that Zeus granted mortals the use of fire.
sentences.chinese: 可是宙斯却是不大乐意允准人们用火的。

sentences.english: The licensing of an indefinite subject is relative to the requirement of the topic.
sentences.chinese: 无定主语的允准跟是否有成分满足话题需求有关。

sentences.english: He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多允准，他就把耶稣的身体领去了。

sentences.english: But it was only rather grudgingly that Jupiter granted mortals the use of fire.
sentences.chinese: 可是，朱庇特却是不大乐意允准人们用火的。

sentences.english: With Pilate's permission, he came and took the body away.
sentences.chinese: 彼拉多允准，他就把耶稣的身体领去了。

sentences.english: And the king granted me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.
sentences.chinese: 王就允准我，因我神施恩的手帮助我。

sentences.english: But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.
sentences.chinese: 然而巴比伦王居鲁士元年，他降旨允准建造神的这殿。

sentences.english: A church council of 382 gave final approval to the list.
sentences.chinese: 382年的一次教会会议最终允准了这一编排。

sentences.english: Permit me, I though a weak.
sentences.chinese: 允准我，我虽是一个弱者。

sentences.english: However, in the first year of Cyrus king of Babylon, King Cyrus issued a decree to rebuild this house of God.
sentences.chinese: 然而巴比伦王古列元年，他降旨允准建造神的这殿。

sentences.english: Athanasius. A church council of 382 gave final approval to the list.
sentences.chinese: 382年的一次教会会议最终允准了这一编排。

sentences.english: They sent also to the king of Moab, and he refused.
sentences.chinese: 又照样打发使者去见摩押王，他也不允准。

definition: approved by His (or Her) Majesty/permission graciously granted (from highly authoritative position)/to graciously permit/to condescend to allow
imperial edict/see also 上諭|上谕[shang4 yu4]
to give a nod of approval
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
